info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 6:22AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED WITH QUICK HITTING STORM SUNDAY... .A fast moving storm system will bring hazardous travel conditions to the mountains on Sunday. Snow will increase this morning, and will be heavy at times especially during the middle of the day. Strong winds and considerable blowing snow will combine with the falling snow to produce near blizzard conditions at times. Road closures will be possible. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow accumulations between 7 and 14 inches, with higher amounts north of Rabbit Ears Pass. Winds gusting between 45 and 65 mph creating near blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times. Road closures are possible. Near blizzard conditions can be expected in exposed areas.
info.instruction: Consider avoiding travel during the worst conditions, which will likely be during the middle of the day today. If you do travel, drive with extreme caution. Take a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1 or visit www.cotrip.org.
